intro: Sulcorebutia platygona, commonly known as the flat-leafed crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-shaped growth habit. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a bluish tint, adapted to store water. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring or early summer. Sulcorebutia platygona is well-suited for arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
